column4: if you ask me, that's pointless because a Win98 boot disk is 100% worthless.  Use a DSL image or something.  DSL = Damn Small Linux
what purpose would a 98 boot disk serve?  No NTFS support, no Ext2/3 support, etc.
then you're asking in the wrong channel as this is the support channel for Ubuntu
if you were to read my question.
I understand the question.  You want to take a .ima/img floppy image and make it bootable on a USB device and that is off topic in relation to Ubuntu.
because I thought i wanted to do this from within linux
changes nothing.  That is off topic.  Please ask that in #ubuntu-offtopic
the point is, it does not matter what I want to do with the disk... the point is I want to extract an IMA to a usb drive from within linux
That is not an #ubuntu question, just ask asking questions about Compiz and usage for it are off topic
so asking how to extract an IMG file to a usb disk in ubuntu is not ubuntu related?
